payload: Global audit of skill implementation, structure, and phrasing against skill-development teachings

Global skill audit: 23 skills reviewed against skill-development standards. Key findings: 1) Description quality varies - agent-browser excellent, ci-pipeline-manager too brief. 2) Writing style generally good (imperative form), but some skills use second person (brainstorming-together, learn-mdrules). 3) Line counts: most under 500 lines, ralph-orchestrator-expert at 515 lines should split content to references/. 4) Third-person descriptions mostly correct, but deploy-production, deployment-pipeline-orchestrator, distributed-processor, multi-session-orchestrator have non-standard descriptions. 5) Progressive disclosure: many skills reference files correctly, but some lack clear references/ structure.

Audit complete. 23 skills reviewed. CRITICAL: 4 skills with non-standard descriptions (ci-pipeline-manager, deployment-pipeline-orchestrator, distributed-processor, multi-session-orchestrator). 2 skills with second-person anti-pattern (brainstorming-together, learn-mdrules). 3 skills exceed 450-line threshold (ralph-orchestrator-expert:515, agent-development:521, mcp-development:603). 3 skills exceed 500-line threshold (command-development:833, hook-development:859, skill-development:666). RECOMMENDATION: Apply skill-development standards systematically - descriptions should use 'This skill should be used when...' with exact trigger phrases; convert second-person to imperative form; split SKILL.md >450 lines to references/.
Skill audit findings review - fixing description patterns, writing style issues, and SKILL.md length compliance

### âŒ ANTI-PATTERNS FOUND

**1. Second-Person Anti-Pattern** ("You are" / "Your job" instead of imperative form):
- brainstorming-together: "You will be manually invoked", "Your job is to" (lines 13, 16)
- learn-mdrules: "You are the MD Metacritic", "Your job is to" (lines 9, 11)
- refine-prompts: "You are a prompt engineering expert", "Your task is to" (line 7)
- meta-critic: "You are an execution skill", "Your job is to" (lines 9, 11)
- claude-md-archivist: "You are a senior engineer", "You know what" (line 12)

**Writing Style Issue**: Per patterns.md, skills should use imperative/infinitive form with NO second person. Instead of "You will be invoked", use "This skill is manually invoked". Instead of "Your job is to", use "The skill must".

**2. Description Pattern Issues** (Not following "This skill should be used when..."):
- claude-md-archivist: Uses imperative statement instead of third-person
- file-search: Uses imperative statement instead of third-person
- manual-e2e-testing: Uses imperative statement instead of third-person
- refine-prompts: Uses imperative statement instead of third-person
- test-manager: Partial compliance - has "Use when:" but missing "This skill should be used when"

- manual-e2e-testing: 470 lines
- agent-development: 521 lines
- mcp-development: 526 lines
- skill-development: 666 lines
- command-development: 833 lines
- hook-development: 859 lines

4. meta-critic: Convert "You are/Your job" to imperative
5. claude-md-archivist: Convert "You are/You know" to imperative

Priority 2 - Fix description patterns (5 skills):
